t: Psalm 31
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
In*pn you, Lord,*s I have taken refuge; let*ld me never be put to shame; deliver*ld me in your righteousness.
Turn*ln your ear to me, come*ld quickly to my rescue; be*ln my rock of refuge, a*ld strong fortress to save me.
Since*ln you are my rock and my fortress, for*ld the sake of your name lead and guide me.
Keep*ln me free from the trap that is set for me, for*ld you are my refuge.
Into*ln your hands I commit my spirit; deliver*ld me, Lord,*s my faithful God.
I*pn hate those who cling to worthless idols; as*ld for me, I trust in the Lord.*s
I*ln will be glad and rejoice in your love, for*ld you saw my affliction and*ld knew the anguish of my soul.
You*ln have not given me into the hands of the enemy but*ld have set my feet in a spacious place.
Be*pn merciful to me, Lord,*s for I am in distress; my*ld eyes grow weak with sorrow, my*ld soul and body with grief.
My*ln life is consumed by anguish and*ld my years by groaning; my*ln strength fails because of my affliction, and*ld my bones grow weak.
Because*ln of all my enemies, I*ld am the utter contempt of my neighbors and*ln an object of dread to my closest friends— those*ld who see me on the street flee from me.
I*ln am forgotten as though I were dead; I*ld have become like broken pottery.
For*ln I hear many whispering, “Terror*ld on every side!” They*ln conspire against me and*ld plot to take my life.
But*pn I trust in you, Lord;*s I*ld say, “You are my God.”
My*ln times are in your hands; deliver*ld me from the hands of my enemies, from*ld those who pursue me.
Let*ln your face shine on your servant; save*ld me in your unfailing love.
Let*ln me not be put to shame, Lord,*s for*ld I have cried out to you; but*ln let the wicked be put to shame and*ld be silent in the realm of the dead.
Let*ln their lying lips be silenced, for*ld with pride and contempt they*ld speak arrogantly against the righteous.
How*pn abundant are the good things that*ld you have stored up for those who fear you, that*ln you bestow in the sight of all, on*ld those who take refuge in you.
In*ln the shelter of your presence you hide them from*ld all human intrigues; you*ln keep them safe in your dwelling from*ld accusing tongues.
Praise*pn be to the Lord,*s for*ld he showed me the wonders of his love when*ld I was in a city under siege.
In*ln my alarm I said, “I*ld am cut off from your sight!” Yet*ln you heard my cry for mercy when*ld I called to you for help.
Love*pn the Lord,*s all his faithful people! The*ld Lord*s preserves those who are true to him, but*ld the proud he pays back in full.
Be*ln strong and take heart, all*ld you who hope in the Lord.*s
